intro: Aragoa kogiorum subsp. sevillae, commonly known as the Seville aragoa, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
